oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Randy Travis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Randy Travis (performer). Segment taped at the request of Warner Brothers and Warner West. Recording is from May 21, 1993.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Randy Travis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery and Randy Travis discuss Wind in the Wire and Chuck Norris' helpful nature -- (05:39) Travis discusses his co-stars on Wind in the Wire -- (06:43) Emery discusses the program with his engineer -- (07:09) ""The Cowboy Boogie"" is told by Travis to be a song for the dance craze -- (08:45) Emery and Travis double back to Western music in Wind in the Wire -- (11:14) Travis and Emery reflect on the current 'Cowboy Singers' -- (11:44) ""Memories of Old Santa Fe"" is told, by Travis, to not be a part of the movie it was written for -- (12:30) Emery inquires about Travis' experience with 'Mexican cowboys' and the 'Tex Mex' sound -- (13:28) Travis recalls a story about how ""Blue Mesa"" was going to be used for the movie -- (15:43) Travis discusses his Western upbringing and Roy Rogers -- (17:21) Travis' ""Too Gone Too Long"" is discussed -- (18:00) Burt Reynolds vocal performance on ""Down at the Old Corral"" is reflected on -- (19:40) ""Roamin' Wyoming"" is told by Travis to be used for the footage from South Dakota, and Emery and Travis discuss Travis' live performances -- (20:49) ""Wind in the Wire"" is told by Travis to be a song brought to the film from a Canadian recording group -- (22:58) Travis and Emery discuss the Western influence on children -- (23:32) ""Paniolo Country"" is told by Travis to be about the Hawaiian Cowboy -- (27:03) Marty Robbins and his influence are discussed in the decision to use ""Hula Hands"" -- (28:57) Emery inquires about Travis' decision to record ""Beyond the Reef"" and ""Hula Hands"" -- (29:54) Emery and Travis recall working at the Cayman Islands -- (31:44) Travis discusses the Pahinui Brothers with Emery, Kapena, and Willie K. -- (33:29) Emery inquires about the difference between country and western music -- (34:09) Emery and Travis reflect on Travis' first interests in country music -- (34:52) Travis and Emery discuss why Americans have an interest in cowboys -- (38:35) Travis recalls what Rogers had gifted him -- (39:27) Travis lists his favorite cowboys -- (40:30) Travis reveals he had been meeting with directors in California
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Travis, Randy;
